description.narrative: Australia's contribution of $90 million to the 2018-20 GPE replenishment will help advance our interests in the region and globally. GPE's strategic objectives are strongly aligned with Australia's, including promoting girls' education and targeting the most vulnerable children, including in fragile contexts. A new GPE financing and funding framework (co-led by Australia) builds on existing strengths, including results-based financing and domestic resource mobilisation, to ensure GPE financing is more catalytic. It improves GPE's approach to scaling innovation, and offers grants to leverage additional education finance at a 1:3 ratio. Australia was influential in securing eligibility for lower-middle income countries and increasing allocations for small island developing states. For 2018-20, GPE has so far allocated over AUD1 billion to 30 eligible Indo-Pacific countries.
